subject: Negotiation
title: Netflix's Content Revolution
description: A short lesson to help you apply Netflix's Content Revolution.

hook.text: Netflix tried to buy itself for $50 million. Blockbuster laughed. Netflix is now worth $250 billion.

buildup.text: In 2000, Netflix's founders offered to sell to Blockbuster for $50 million and were rejected.

discovery.text: Blockbuster's executives couldn't see past their own business model â€” stores, late fees, physical media.

twist.text: Netflix pivoted to streaming, spent billions on original content, and destroyed Blockbuster.

climax.text: The company Blockbuster rejected became the company that made Blockbuster extinct.

punchline.text: The deal you reject today might become the competitor that kills you.

quiz.question: Why did Blockbuster reject Netflix's offer?
options: They couldn't see past their own business model
Netflix was asking for too much control
